column5: This made me giggle. Love it. 😍

Overall, not bad. Being unemployed (film production) sucks but I’m glad unemployment insurance is juuuuust enough to cover most of my bills. 

Have you also been having really fucked up dreams? What kind of work do you do?

Thanks, everyone! 

The t-shirt features my artwork, but for privacy reasons I can’t share the link here.

Oh my god! I honestly didn’t expect such an outpouring. 

I’ve been dealing with a lot lately, and it’s been difficult not to feel like utter shite. 

Thank you so much for your warmth. 💕

I agree with a lot of what’s been said here, but I mostly just wanted to add that I’m thrilled you’re here seeking advice! 

The fact that you’ve done so speaks of your intentions. As a trans woman who’s only ever dated cis guys, I think it’s rad! 

I hope you keep us updated.
Love love LOVE! I’d love to know more about the series.

I met my ex-boyfriend of over a year on Tinder (and we’ve talked about getting back together). There ARE some gems. 

That said, I have extremely low expectations when it comes to that app. I know my ex was clearly an exception to what seems Tinder’s rule. We didn’t even have sex until our fourth date. A lot of guys seem to just swipe on the first picture they see. A lot also just “swipe right on everyone then sort through matches” according to one guy I matched with and asked. 

I thought Bumble had a bit more depth, but even there I ended up having a great date with a guy, only to have him not actually read my bio until THREE days after our date.

God! The rolled up sleeves just add to it all. 
😍😍😍
I love how the bat looks so cozy peeking out from under your shirt. 😊

I’m so fascinated by this. If I didn’t have credit card debt I’d probably join in a heartbeat.

I’m curious, because duh: Are there any LGBTQ members that you know of?

I’m so fascinated by this. If I didn’t have credit card debt I’d probably join in a heartbeat. 😊

Curious as to LGBTQ members, because... duh.
I’d like it all delivered, please. 😍
Love that you’re a Nintendo fan. 😊

Saddest episode to date. I cried for much of it. 

I just wanted SOMEONE to hold Adam. 

Aimee’s assault, sadly, brought up some of my own experiences. I knew she’d break down eventually when she got home. All too relatable. 

Eric’s date was the cutest thing. He’s been long overdue for someone like Rahim. 

All that said, I’m completely over the Otis and Maeve thing. I, for one, think Maeve would be bored of Otis after just a week of dating.

As long as not telling them is mostly YOUR decision. My now ex-husband didn’t want his family and friends to know I was trans. He asked me to basically hide or delete all my pre-transition photos on social media when we got serious. I hated to do so but I loved him. 

It created SUCH a gulf between me and literally everyone I met through him and with him. It made me anxious. We fought every time a friend or family member of his would be our houseguest. It wasn’t until couples’ therapy that I realized it was because my home couldn’t be my sanctuary if people didn’t know that I was trans. So we had a rule that he would have to tell anyone he invited to stay with us. 

Even now that we’ve split, there are STILL people, who have known me for years, who just assume I’m a cis woman. It might sound like a great thing, but I can’t open up or even relax around people like that, so I avoid them, and that’s incredibly isolating at times.

My sister (4 years my senior) is much worse, which is why I don’t even speak with her. 

I began HRT at 29, just a couple months before my 30th birthday. She was well aware, but still mailed me a ‘Happy Birthday Little Brother’ card. 

Fast forward three years, and she misgendered me during dinner with my boyfriend (who became my husband) at the time. I’d warned him before we got out of the car. I told him she would misgender me, and that I wouldn’t correct her because of her proclivity for drama.

I believe in creating my own family, and I’ve done so over the years with some incredible friends.

Easily the sexiest photo I’ve seen all day. 

Fuuuuuuck. 😍

Yes. Not to say she hasn’t been an asshat over the years. Like telling me, after I got married five years ago, that I wouldn’t be “Mrs” until I had reassignment surgery. 

I emailed her an article on why pronouns matter, and told her that she’d had years to get her shit together, and if she wasn’t in 100% she needed to fuck all the way off. She apologized.
My mother asked me this question when I announced my decision to begin my transition. She was the only one to ask.
Hehehe... That just made me like this video even more. That was a nice sprinkling of adorable on top of a whole lot of sexy.

I had a similar conversation with an Internet stranger just yesterday. 


My response:

“People don’t usually run around thinking of their identity they just ARE. I don’t constantly think, ‘I’m trans. I’m trans. I’m trans...’ or ‘I’m a woman. I’m a woman. I’m a woman...’ like some sort of looped recording no more than I’m almost certain you don’t think ‘I’m a man. I’m a man. I’m a man...’. You’re just you. 😊”
Tell me about it. All missionary, and zero passion.
It doesn’t take much to just skim a profile, and I mention being trans right at the very top of mine. 😉

“What’s that sound? Do you hear it? It’s a funny squeaky sound.”

“You couldn’t hear a dump truck driving through a nitroglycerin plant.”

😂
I wouldn’t be able to keep my hands off you either. 😉
I like my eggs over medium, please.
Fuuuuuck! This is so fucking hot.
Uh. Can’t talk with my mouth full.
I should be holding... the tape measure.
I volunteer! I volunteer as tribute!
